title: Romantic England. No. 9 [Edward V, 1483]
brief_description: Historical documentary about King Edward V and his ruthless and cunning uncle, Richard, Duke of Gloucester, who plotted and schemed to depose the young Edward from the throne. It tells of the two princes, Edward and his younger brother Richard, and how their uncle sent them to imprisonment and their eventual death in the Tower, naming himself as the rightful heir to the crown. Commentary written by Horace Shepherd and spoken by Neal Arden.
